(Complete Topic - Il folle volo:  A Transnational/Translational approach to the journey motif in Italian literature and cinema)
Porcarelli  TT 11:20-12:35 online synchronous
Content: From its beginning literature has found a central theme in the journey metaphor; be it physical or symbolic.  In this course, by using a transnational/translational approach, we will explore the ways travel narratives dwell on notions of chances and choice, discovery and change, and search and struggle. By portraying Italy as an in-between space, geographically and historically characterized by internal and external transits, we will look at the journey motive as a privileged tool to shape, negotiate and challenge identity. During the semester we will read a variety of texts organized in chronological order, beginning with the rendering of Ulysses' travel in Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy, all the way to contemporary postcolonial and migration travel narratives.
